title: [Large-Scale] Designing Learning Engagement and Co-Creation of Value in Online Science Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science education theory and experience in operating online learning platforms
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers conducting projects to design online learning environments in the field of science.

learning_goals: Cultivation of data collection and analysis skills using a four-dimensional (behavioral, cognitive, emotional, social) online learning engagement measurement tool.
Development of competency in analyzing causal relationships between learning engagement factors and motivation using structural equation modeling (SEM).

Learners can analyze learner characteristics (age, learning style, technology accessibility, etc.) when designing online science projects, propose three or more value co-creation strategies (e.g., collaborative platform utilization, personalized feedback systems, gamification application), and develop a project design plan achieving over 80% suitability through peer evaluation and instructor verification.

Learners can analyze formative assessment data (quiz accuracy rates below 85%, discussion participation in the bottom 20%) from online learning platforms over six months, propose three or more specific measures (e.g., content restructuring such as video segmentation and supplementary materials, interaction improvements like real-time feedback systems and discussion board redesigns), and achieve target satisfaction levels in peer evaluations (4+ on a 5-point scale) and instructor feedback (80%+ on rubric assessments).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
